qas.question: What colors did many websites convert their home pages to?
What did internet portals remove from their home pages?
Many of what shut down completely?
What did the crowds in Tiananmen Square do after the moment of silence?

context: Many websites converted their home page to <a0_0>black and white<a0_0/>; Sina.com and Sohu, major internet portals, limited their homepages to news items and removed <a1_0>all advertisements<a1_0/>. Chinese video sharing websites Youku and Tudou displayed a black background and placed multiple videos showing earthquake footage and news reports. The Chinese version of MSN, cn.msn.com, also displayed banner ads about the earthquake and the relief efforts. Other entertainment websites, including <a2_0>various gaming sites<a2_0/>, such as the Chinese servers for World of Warcraft, had shut down altogether, or had corresponding links to earthquake donations. After the moments of silence, in Tiananmen Square, crowds spontaneously <a3_0>burst out cheering<a3_0/> various slogans, including "Long Live China". <a4_0>Casinos<a4_0/> in Macau closed down.
